victim.name: Iris Bell
victim.description: A luminous torch singer at The Silver Gull nightclub in Greywater City; known for a sapphire locket and a habit of keeping every contract carbon in her vanity.

crime_scene: Backstage dressing room at The Silver Gull, Dockside District, Greywater City, on a rain-lashed night in 1947.

suspects.name: Miriam Kline
suspects.description: Angular, quick-fingered pianist and arranger with a portable Underwood typewriter and a temper kept under a lid.
suspects.connection: Iris’s accompanist, songwriter, and once her closest confidante; lately sidelined as Iris courted a major-label deal.
suspects.alibi: Claims she was performing live on WRCN’s 'Night Owls Revue' from 10–11 p.m.; the announcer and studio engineer remember her at the station, and she says she never left the studio while the ON AIR light was glowing.

suspects.name: Claude Delaney
suspects.description: Silk-tongued owner of The Silver Gull, white suit gone gray at the cuffs; drowning in gambling markers.
suspects.connection: Iris’s employer and rumored lover; stood to lose his headliner—and leverage—if she jumped to a label.
suspects.alibi: Says he was in a high-stakes poker game at the Crescent Hotel from 9 p.m. to 1 a.m.; four players, the elevator man, and the switchboard logs put him on the 15th floor the entire hour of the murder.

suspects.name: Lt. Frank Rourke
suspects.description: Weathered vice-squad lieutenant with a scar like a second frown; doesn’t mind rain or pay envelopes.
suspects.connection: A sometime protector and secret paramour of Iris; she was said to be holding receipts that could sink him.
suspects.alibi: Booked in on a vice raid at the Havana Rooms from 10 to 11:30 p.m.; charge sheets and three officers back him up.

motive: Iris discovered a forged publishing transfer Miriam typed, cutting Iris out of songwriting royalties if she signed her new record deal. Iris threatened to go to the district attorney—using Rourke as the door—and to name Miriam as the forger. Facing ruin and the loss of the only career she had, Miriam strangled Iris in a desperate bid to keep the betrayal buried.

key_clues.name: Transcription Disc with Cue Marks
key_clues.location: WRCN Radio—control room archive cabinet, under a stack of blank acetates
key_clues.description: The 'live' 10–11 p.m. broadcast was actually two 30‑minute acetates cut at 7:15 p.m., grease‑penciled 'AIR 10:00'. A thumbprint-smudged cue at the side change shows the engineer could run it without the pianist present, undercutting Miriam’s 'never left the studio' claim and giving her a window to reach the club.

key_clues.name: Piano Wire Sleeve and Rosin Smears
key_clues.location: Backstage rehearsal room at The Silver Gull—hidden in the little compartment inside the piano bench lid
key_clues.description: A torn paper sleeve for a No. 2 treble wire with rosin traces and a partial fingerprint matching Miriam. The victim’s ligature marks show fine ridging consistent with a treble string rather than a scarf or cord.

key_clues.name: Carbon Copy of a Publishing Transfer
key_clues.location: Miriam Kline’s apartment—taped behind a framed publicity photo above the upright piano
key_clues.description: A carbon copy assigning song rights from Iris to Miriam. The typing shows a distinct misaligned 'Q' and a chipped lowercase 'e' that match Miriam’s portable Underwood; Iris’s signature is a traced forgery.

red_herring.name: Monogrammed Cufflink
red_herring.location: Alley storm drain behind The Silver Gull
red_herring.description: A brass cufflink engraved 'FR' snagged in the grate. It seems to place Lt. Rourke near the scene, but he lost it during a quarrel with Iris the previous night and never returned.
